Reason: The _journalAgeThreshold configuration option in the prevayler software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the frequency at which journal entries are flushed to disk. A lower threshold value may result in more frequent disk writes, increasing I/O operations and potentially slowing down system performance. Conversely, a higher threshold value may delay the flushing of journal entries, leading to increased memory consumption and potential performance degradation due to increased memory pressure.
